'Sofia' (, ) is the capital and largest city of Bulgaria. Sofia is located at
the foot of Mount Vitosha in the western part of the country. It occupies a
strategic position at the centre of the Balkan Peninsula. Sofia's
history spans 2,400 years. Its ancient name Serdica derives from the local
Celtic tribe of the [[serdi]] who established the town in the 5th century BC. It
remained a relatively small settlement until 1879, when it was declared the
capital of Bulgaria.

Sofia is the 15th largest city in the European Union with a population of around
1.3 million people, or 1,241,396 in the city proper.

Sofia has been ranked by the Globalization and World Cities Research Network as
a beta city. [http://bcg.thetimes.co.uk/Europe/Bulgaria/Sofia Sofia], [[The
Times]]. Retrieved March 23, 2011 Many of the major universities, cultural
institutions, and businesses of Bulgaria are concentrated in
Sofia. [http://www.internethostelsofia.hostel.com/ Internet Hostel Sofia,
Tourism in Sofia]. Retrieved Jan, 2012
categories: Populated places established in the 8th century BC
